newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia denies mulling partial autonomy in Timor.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia denies mulling partial autonomy in Timor.

text.p: Indonesia denied on Monday that it was considering granting partial autonomy to its troubled territory of East Timor.

The Portuguese weekly Expresso on Saturday quoted Jakarta's special ambassador for East Timor, Francisco Lopez da Cruz, as saying President Suharto had agreed to review the status of East Timor with a view to granting it partial autonomy.
Da Cruz told Reuters he had been misquoted.
"For the time being, there is nothing at all," da Cruz said.
Da Cruz said he would meet Suharto later this month for a discussion on the former Portuguese colony and would then be able to comment more fully on Jakarta's plans for the territory.

Indonesia invaded East Timor in 1975 and annexed it a year later. The United Nations does not recognise Indonesian rule in East Timor, which lies about 500 kms (300 miles) north of Australia, and regards Portugal as the administering power.
